BY RUTTONSUS PIJRSHO^AM OF MUSCAT TO CAPTAIN REPAY ZACHARIAH COX HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S CONSUL AND POLITICAL AGENT AT MUSCAT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNMENT OF INDIA OF A HOUSE , AT MUSCAT IN ARABIA IN CONSIDERATION OF FORTY SIX THOUSAND AND EIGHT HUNDRED RUPEES PAID BY THE LATTER TO THE FORMER. * 1 - 1, RUTTONSIE PURSHOTAJV1 BAI'flAN TRADER OF MUSCAT, being seized .of and obher^fise well entitled to and heritable proprietor > fflfcgjTcr, a ; \ iX^T r 'iff S' ^ ‘ rr V v t , * r - - ' of the subjects hereinafter disposed of In CONSIDERATION OF THE SUM OF FORTY SIX THOUSAND AND EIGHT HUNDRED RUPEES IN STANTLY PAID TO ME by Captain Percy Zachariah COX H.B.M.'s Consul & Political Agent on behalf of the GOVERNMENT OF IN DIA, of which sum I do hereby acknowledge the receipt in full settlement,do hereby grant bargain sell and convey to the said Captain Percy Zachariah COX H.B.M.'s CONSUL & POLITICAL AGENT and assignees whomsoever,heritably and irredeemably all that piece or parcel of land at Muscat with the houses godowns warehouses and all else thereon and having a frontage on the northern side of about one hundred and seventy three ieotand bounded on the north by the seashore on the east by ohe house of the agent of Gordhandas Ruttonchani at Muscat on the west by H.B.M.'s Consulate and on the south by the lane between these premises and the building now used as the Agency Hos pital, together with all out houses building yards paths pas sages lights and privileges and appurtenances whatsoever to the said piece of land and house and premises belonging or - in any way appertaining or now or at any time heretofore possessed or engaged or accepted' deemed taken or known as part parcel or member thereof and appurtenant thereto,and my whole right title and interest present and future.therein together with all deeds writings and evidences of title re lating thereto which was and is in the custody possession or power of the said Ruttonsie Purshotam or any person from whom I can procure them. Which subjects consist of the house warehouses and godowns now known as Ruttonsie's house warehouses and godowns to have and to hold the said piece or parcelI parcel of ground with t»he house warehouses godowns building or huildings hereditaments and premises hereinbefore described and hereby assured or intended so to be with the appui tenances half of the Government of India in perpetuity, IN WITNESS WHEFEOF THESE PRESENTS ARE SUBSCRIBED BY ME and I have hereunto set my hand and seal at Muscat this the ninth day oi August in the year of Grace nineteen hundred and one before these wit nesses Captain P.Z.COX H.B.M. 9 s CONSUL & POLITICAL AGENT at Muscat and LIONEL E.KERSHAW Consular Clerk oi; H. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File XXII/5 Houses and Landed Property Deeds in connection with the purchase by Govt. of the premises adjoining the British Consulate at Muscat in August. 1901 (near British Consular Escort Lines).’

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in a random order from the front to the rear of the volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the first folio with 1 and terminates at the last folio with 12; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.The foliation sequence does not include the front and back covers, nor does it include the 2 leading and ending flyleaves.

mods.abstract: The volume contains conveyances and sale deeds of properties in Muscat, which were purchased by the British Consulate at Muscat, on behalf of the British Government. It also contains sale deeds between foreigners in Muscat that have been approved by the British Consulate Court at Muscat.
